Package integrals

Class ApproximateIntegral

java.lang.Object
integrals.ApproximateIntegral
public class ApproximateIntegral extends Object
ApproximateIntegral provides static methods to estimate integrals using the Left Endpoint Rule, Right Endpoint Rule, Midpoint Rule, Trapezoidal Rule, and/or Simpsonâ€™s Rule. Both a set of recursive and iterative methods are provided. The interval of integration is assumed to be continuous.
Since:
3/24/22

Updated 4/3/22

Updated 4/11/22

Author:
Ayesha Ilyas

  • Constructor Details

    • ApproximateIntegral

      public ApproximateIntegral()

  • Method Details

    • leftEndpointRule

      public static double leftEndpointRule(Function function, double a, double b, int n, boolean showSteps)
      Iteratively approximates an integral using the Left Endpoint Rule.
      Parameters:
      function - a Function object
      a - a double representing the lower bound of the interval of integration. a should be strictly less than b.
      b - a double representing the upper bound of the interval of integration. b should be strictly greater than a.
      n - an int specifying how many subintervals to use in the approximation. n should be a positive integer greater than 0.
      showSteps - a boolean that determines whether the steps used to compute the integral should be shown. If showSteps if true, the steps will be shown, otherwise the steps will not be shown.
      Returns:
      a double approximation of the integral using the Left Endpoint Rule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a is not less then b and/or n is not greater than 0
      ArithmeticException - if an endpoint is not in the domain of the function

    • rightEndpointRule

      public static double rightEndpointRule(Function function, double a, double b, int n, boolean showSteps)
      Iteratively approximates an integral using the Right Endpoint Rule.
      Parameters:
      function - a Function object
      a - a double representing the lower bound of the interval of integration. a should be strictly less than b.
      b - a double representing the upper bound of the interval of integration. b should be strictly greater than a.
      n - an int specifying how many subintervals to use in the approximation. n should be a positive integer greater than 0.
      showSteps - a boolean that determines whether the steps used to compute the integral should be shown. If showSteps if true, the steps will be shown, otherwise the steps will not be shown.
      Returns:
      a double approximation of the integral using the Right Endpoint Rule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a is not less then b and/or n is not greater than 0
      ArithmeticException - if an endpoint is not in the domain of the function

    • midpointRule

      public static double midpointRule(Function function, double a, double b, int n, boolean showSteps)
      Iteratively approximates an integral using the Midpoint Rule.
      Parameters:
      function - a Function object
      a - a double representing the lower bound of the interval of integration. a should be strictly less than b.
      b - a double representing the upper bound of the interval of integration. b should be strictly greater than a.
      n - an int specifying how many subintervals to use in the approximation. n should be a positive integer greater than 0.
      showSteps - a boolean that determines whether the steps used to compute the integral should be shown. If showSteps if true, the steps will be shown, otherwise the steps will not be shown.
      Returns:
      a double approximation of the integral using the Left Endpoint Rule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a is not less then b and/or n is not greater than 0
      ArithmeticException - if a midpoint is not in the domain of the function
